data.title: Venture Life Chair to Step Down, Successor Named
data.description:
Venture Life Group Nonexecutive Chair Paul McGreevy will step down from the board in late April, according to a Tuesday filing.

McGreevy decided to leave his position due to a potential conflict of interest between the self-care products company's recent expansion and his role as the current chief executive officer of Revive Active Ltd.

Venture Life named Nonexecutive Director Mark Adams as its new board chair, effective at the time of McGreevy's resignation.

data.title: Shell Restarts Production at the Penguins Field in the UK North Sea
BNP Paribas Growth Targets Could Lead to Consensus Upgrades â€” Market Talk
data.description: BNP Paribas reported strong underlying trends for the fourth quarter and consensus expectations could rise, RBC Capital Markets analyst Anke Reingen says in a research note. The French bank's quarterly result as well as it CET1 ratio exceeded expectations, the analyst says. The bank's new 2024-2026 net income growth rate target suggests at least a 4% consensus upgrade, Reingen says. The slight fall in the bank's 2025 return on tangible equity to 11.5% from a range of 11.5% to 12% previously, given consensus expectations at 10.4%, should offer relief to investors fearing a steeper downgrade. BNP Paribas' targeted revenue growth of at least 5% per year for 2025-2026 is also higher than investors had expected. BNP shares trade 2.5% higher to 65.94 euros. (pierre.bertrand@wsj.com)

data.title: Indonesia says France's Eramet exploring new mining areas in South Sulawesi, Papua
data.description:
Indonesia's investment minister said on Tuesday French miner Eramet is exploring new mining areas in the South Sulawesi and Papua regions.

Rosan Roeslani on his Instagram account said he met with Eramet's Group CEO, Christel Bories, on Monday and he was updated on Eramet's investment plans.

"Eramet outlined its investment plans, including exploration of new areas in South Sulawesi and Papua as well as the development of the Responsible Green Electric Vehicle project involving various strategic partners," Rosan said.

Eramet could not immediately be reached for comment.

Eramet's main operation in Indonesia is its Weda Bay Nickel mine, located in Halmahera, North Maluku.

data.title: Pennant Group Expands Footprint in Idaho, Texas With Three Senior Living Acquisitions
data.description:
Pennant Group said it acquired three senior living facilities in Idaho and Texas, expanding its national footprint by 188 units in "key" markets, effective Feb. 1.

The company said the acquisition in Idaho is subject to a triple net lease with the option to purchase, and the two Texas facilities are subject to a long-term, triple net lease.

The company did not disclose the deal's financial details in a statement late Monday.

data.title: Fruitas OKs Share Repurchase Program Worth Up to PHP100 Million
data.description:
Fruitas (PSE: FRUIT) approved a share buyback program worth up to 100 million Philippine pesos to boost shareholder value.

The program will have an initial one-year term and will be executed through open-market purchases on the Philippine bourse, according to a Tuesday Philippine bourse filing.

The initiative will be funded internally, and will not impact ongoing or future projects, it said.

data.title: Shell: Total Recoverable Resource Volume Seen at 100 Million BOE
Shell: Peak Production Seen 45,000 Barrels of Oil Equivalent Per Day
News Highlights: Top Energy News of the Day - Tuesday at 4 AM ET
data.description:
OMV's Net Profit Rises Despite Weak Refining Margins

The oil-and-gas company's refining margin fell to $5.9 a barrel, compared with $9.9 a barrel a year ago.

Oil Rises as Trump's Tariffs Raise Supply Fears

Prices jumped on concerns that U.S. tariffs against its major trade partners could disrupt supplies and raise prices at the pump.

Exxon Enters the Electricity Business, Takes a Swipe at Nuclear

Exxon says it can compete with nuclear, because the gas power plants it intends to build would capture carbon emissions.

U.S. Frackers and Saudi Officials Tell Trump They Won't Drill More

The president says lower prices could solve a range of problems, but finds early resistance in the oil market.

Exxon, Chevron Yearly Profits Down as Investor Payouts Hit Fresh Highs

Annual profits fell, but the oil giants made record distributions to shareholders as production rose to historic levels in key regions.

Energy & Utilities Roundup: Market Talk

Read about tariffs on Canadian oil, natural gas prices, Galp Energia and more in the latest Market Talks covering Energy and Utilities.

Orsted Replaces CEO as Wind Industry Faces Challenges

The company said it is parting ways with Mads Nipper as it grapples with supply-chain bottlenecks, high financing costs and President Trump's opposition to wind power.

Tariffs Won't Sink Canadian Oil Companies

The U.S. has become reliant on their crude, and Canada has ways to limit any financial hit.

Shell Keeps $3.5 Billion Buyback Amid Earnings Miss

The oil-and-gas company's adjusted earnings fell more than expected, weighed by lower oil prices and refining margins.

U.S. Crude Oil Stockpiles Rise for First Time in 10 Weeks

U.S. crude oil inventories increased for the first time in 10 weeks, beating analyst's expectations, as exports fell and refineries lowered their capacity use.

data.title: Invitation to the presentation of Vestumâ€™s Year-End report for 2024
data.description:
Vestum AB (publ) will publish its Year-End report for 2024 on 13 February 2025 at 07:00 CET and invites to a presentation via a webcast conference call on the same date at 11:00 CET. Simon GÃ¶thberg, CEO and Olof Andersson, CFO will present the report and answer questions. The presentation will be held in English.

Webcast presentation

If you wish to participate via audiocast please use the link below. Via the audiocast you are able to ask written questions.

Teleconference

The presentation slides used will be available during the webcast and will be published on the companyâ€™s website, https://www.vestum.se/en/ir/financial-reports/, before the start of the presentation.

data.title: Yamato Holdings Logs 39% Lower Attributable Profit for Nine Months to December 2024
data.description:
Yamato Holdings recorded a profit attributable to owners of the parent of 28.9 billion yen for the nine months ended Dec. 31,Â 2024,Â 38.5% lower than 46.9 billion yen logged for the same period a year ago.

The company's basic earnings per share for the reporting period decreased to 84.40 yen from 132.75 yen per share a year ago, according to a Monday filing with the Tokyo Exchange.

The operating revenue of the delivery company came in at 1.345 trillion yen, 1.6% lower than 1.367 trillion yen a year earlier.

It forecasted an attributable profit of 18 billion yen, basic EPS of 53.08 yen, an operating revenue of 1.760 trillion yen, and a final dividend of 23 yen per share for the fiscal year ending March. 31.

The company's shares closed nearly 4% higher on Tuesday.

data.title: Investment Evolution Credit Completes Share Sale
data.description:
Investment Evolution Credit (IEC.AQ) raised 35,650 pounds sterling by issuing 3,565,000 new ordinary shares at 0.005 pound each through a subscription by shareholders and director Richard Leaver.

The UK-based financial technology group will use the proceeds to fund its business plan and as general working capital, according to a Tuesday release.

data.title: Buy Triveni Turbine; target of Rs 800 Prabhudas Lilladher
data.description:
Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Triveni Turbine

Triveni Turbine (TRIV) reported revenue growth of 16.6% YoY in Q3FY25. EBITDA margin improved by 232bps YoY to 21.7%. Despite subdued domestic order booking during the quarter, enquiry generation remained strong across key industrial segments such as steel, cement, and oil & gas. Encouraged by an uptick in domestic order finalization in Q3, the management expects improved order booking in Q4FY25. TRIVâ€™s strategic entry into CO2-based energy storage systems marks a significant growth opportunity, positioning it at the forefront of emerging energy transition technologies. This initiative, coupled with its planned annual capex of Rs1.2-1.5bn to enhance and modularize its capabilities, including investments in R&D, will drive the next phase of growth. Internationally, TRIV continues to witness robust demand from the renewable energy sector, particularly in waste-to-heat energy, geothermal, small modular reactors, and biomass-based power generation. Additionally, its strong order book for API and IPG turbines provides visibility for sustained growth in the products segment. The company is also leveraging its expanding aftermarket offeringsâ€”including spare parts, services, and refurbishmentsâ€”to strengthen its presence in the rotating equipment space.

Outlook

We believe TRIVâ€™s prospects continue to remain strong due to 1) healthy enquiry pipeline across markets, 2) growing share of higher margin exports & aftermarket sales, 3) strong traction in both industrial & API drive turbines, and 4) robust order book with strong inflows across businesses. The stock is trading at a P/E of 39.6x/30.0x on FY26/27E EPS. We maintain our â€˜Buyâ€™ rating with a TP of Rs800 (same as earlier), valuing the stock at a P/E of 43x Sep-26E (same as earlier).

For all recommendations report,Â click here

Disclaimer:Â The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

Triveni Turbine - 04022025 - prabhu

data.title: Mayer Steel Pipe Hit By Cyberattack
data.description:
Some of Mayer Steel Pipe's information service systems were affected by a cyberattack on Sunday, according to a same-day Taiwan Exchange filing.

The company, however, immediately activated defense and recovery mechanisms, preventing further security issues.

Mayer Steel Pipes' operations remain unaffected, it said.

data.title: MRP Agro Launches New Pulses Products in India
data.description:
MRP Agro has launched five new products in the pulses space in the domestic market, according to a Tuesday filing to the BSE.

The new products include Janm Silver urad mogar, Janm Gold urad gota, Janm Platinum urad mogar, Black Diamond urad pulses, and JK Bold No. 1 urad mogar.

These products will be sold in 30 kg packets and will be supplied locally across districts in the state of Madhya Pradesh.

Shares of the company were up over 1% in recent trade.

data.title: Euro Near 3-Week Lows
data.description:
The euro hovered around $1.03, near three-week lows, as traders remained cautious amid escalating trade tensions.

While President Trump delayed the planned 25% tariffs on Mexico and Canada for a month in exchange for commitments to curb migration and drug trafficking at the border, the 10% US tariffs on Chinese imports took effect, prompting immediate retaliation from Beijing.

Despite these tensions, investors remain hopeful that an upcoming phone call between Trump and President Xi could ease hostilities and potentially lead to a rollback of tariffs.

However, lingering uncertainty, coupled with the ECBâ€™s dovish stance and the possibility of further rate cuts, continued to weigh on the euro.

Last week, the ECB cut interest rates by 25bps as expected.

Meanwhile, fresh data showed that inflation in the Euro Area edged up to 2.5% in January, the highest since July 2024 and above expectations of 2.4%.

Core inflation remained steady at 2.7%, defying forecasts of a slight dip to 2.6%.

data.title: Gilt Yields Edge Higher; Tariffs Could Be a Worry for U.K. Investors â€” Market Talk
data.description: The yields on U.K. government bonds, or gilts, rise, tracking moves in their U.S. and eurozone counterparts after U.S. President Trump paused tariffs on Canada and Mexico for a month, sparking a shift away from safe-haven bonds for now. Tariffs remain a risk and investors are concerned about the harm this could do to the U.K. economy, dampening growth while lifting inflation, Pantheon Macroeconomics economists say in a note. "We think President Trump's tariffs, by fracturing supply chains, will be stagflationary for the U.K." Tariffs could potentially mean fewer interest-rate cuts by the Bank of England as inflation rebounds, the economists say. The 10-year gilt yield climbs 4 basis points to last trade at 4.520%, Tradeweb data show. (miriam.mukuru@wsj.com)

data.title: Sterling Weakens on Trade War Fears
data.description:
The British pound fell to $1.242 as concerns over US tariffs continued to rattle markets.

China responded to Trumpâ€™s 10% tariff on its imports by imposing levies on US goods and launching an investigation into Google, reigniting trade war fears.

Meanwhile, some market turmoil eased after Mexico and Canada announced a one-month tariff delay.

With trade tensions escalating, investors increased bets on Bank of England rate cuts to support the economy.

Markets now price in at least three quarter-point cuts this year, with a rising possibility of a fourth.

A rate cut at Thursdayâ€™s BoE meetingâ€”from 4.75% to 4.5%â€”is seen as nearly certain, with odds reaching 98%.

data.title: Sao Paulo Monthly Inflation Rate at 4-Month Low
data.description:
Consumer prices in Sao Paulo, Brazil's most populous city, rose by 0.24% month-over-month in January 2025, following a 0.34% increase in the prior month.

This was the smallest increase in consumer prices in four months, amid slowing prices of food (0.67% vs 0.95% in December) and personal care (0.35% vs 1.41%).

Additionally, prices declined faster for housing (-1.14% vs -0.63%).

data.title: China kills energy trade with the US, but initial impact is limited: Russell
data.description:
The trade in crude oil, liquefied natural gas and coal between the United States and China is effectively dead after Beijing responded to President Donald Trump's tariffs with measures of its own.

China, the world's biggest importer of the three energy commodities, on Tuesday slapped import duties of 15% on U.S. LNG and coal, and 10% on crude oil and farm equipment.

Beijing's move came after the Trump administration imposed an additional 10% tariff on all imports of Chinese goods into the United States.

While the 10% impost was lower than the up to 60% threatened by Trump during his campaign last year to reclaim the U.S. presidency, it was still enough to prompt an immediate response from China.

China's reaction raises the risk of further moves by the United States, and ratchets up the trade tension between the world's two largest economies.

The risk is that a series of tit-for-tat measures causes global economic growth to slow and inflation to rise as countries have to re-order supply chains and deal with increased disruptions to industries such as manufacturing and construction.

However, the immediate impact of China's measures on imports of U.S. crude, LNG and coal is likely to be limited.

China imported 5.99 million barrels of crude from the United States in January, according to commodity analysts Kpler.

This is equivalent to about 193,000 barrels per day, which is less than 2% of China's total imports.

The January imports were typical of volumes in recent months, although China has imported more U.S. crude on occasion, with the 948,000 bpd of June 2023 being the highest in the past two years.

China's LNG imports from the United States have also been modest in recent months, with January coming in at 190,000 metric tons, down from 220,000 tons in December.

The LNG volumes have been fairly volatile, reflecting the spot nature of the trade between the United States and China, but the highest in the past two years was 780,000 tons in October last year.

China's total LNG imports have been averaging around 6.5 million tons a month recently, meaning the U.S. is supplying in a range between 4% and 12% of the total.

China's imports of coal from the United States were 1.34 million tons in January, according to Kpler, with the strongest month in the past two years being 1.55 million in August last year.

Official customs data showed China's total coal imports averaged 45.2 million tons per month in 2024, making the U.S. little more than a fringe supplier.

BROADER IMPLICATIONS

Given that both China and the United States can probably adapt without too much inconvenience to Beijing's tariffs on energy imports, the question then becomes whether it matters.

The answer is that it amplifies tensions and accelerates the trend of increasingly splitting the world into two trading blocs, one that does business with Trump's America and its allies, and one that prefers to deal with China and what has been described as the global south.

The risk is that Trump continues to attack both his traditional allies and rivals with tariffs as part of his "America first" agenda, a policy that may serve to drive commodity producers more towards the emerging BRICS trading bloc.

China is also flexing its muscle in commodities by announcing new export controls on five minerals that are used in defence and energy transition industries.

The controls, which come into effect immediately, cover the metals tungsten, tellurium, bismuth, indium and molybdenum and their related products.

The measures make it more likely that Western nations will seek to find and develop their own supplies.

But this will mean having to engage with companies and governments in Africa, Asia and Latin America, many of which are likely to be targets of Trump's tariff and aid measures.

The views expressed here are those of the author, a columnist for Reuters.

data.title: Grab Mulls Takeover of GoTo at $7 Billion Valuation, Bloomberg Says, Citing Sources
data.description:
• Grab Holdings is weighing a takeover of rival GoTo Group at a valuation of more than $7 billion, Bloomberg reported Tuesday, citing unnamed sources.
  • The companies have held on-and-off talks for years, Bloomberg said.
  • Discussions have intensified in recent weeks and the companies see this year as an opportune time for a deal, the people said, according to Bloomberg.
  • A GoTo spokesperson declined to comment, while Grab had no immediate comment, the Bloomberg report said.

Full story: https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-02-04/grab-goto-accelerate-merger-talks-and-aim-for-deal-in-2025

Write to Kimberley Kao at kimberley.kao@wsj.com

data.title: BNP Paribas's Profit Exceeds Expectations â€” Market Talk
data.description: BNP Paribas's fourth-quarter profit exceeded market views thanks in part to its corporate and institutional banking business, Barclays analyst Flora Bocahut says in a research note. The company's commercial, personal banking and services division also drove the 4% consensus beat, the analyst says. BNP Paribas's investment and protection services unit disappointed but the business should benefit later this year from external growth, the analyst says. Meanwhile, the bank's targets for 2026 are slightly ahead of consensus, the analyst says. BNP Paribas shares trade 2.7% higher at 66.09 euros. (pierre.bertrand@wsj.com)

data.title: FTSE Bursa Malaysia KLCI Index Ends 0.7% Higher at 1564.56
T-Mobile USA Plans to Offer Euro-Denominated Senior Notes
data.description:
T-Mobile US said Tuesday its T-Mobile USA unit intends to offer euro-denominated senior notes in a registered public offering.

Terms of the offering were not disclosed.

The unit plans to use the net proceeds for general corporate purposes, the company said.

data.title: Mobico Group Chair to Step Down
data.description:
Mobico Group Chair Helen Weir intends to step down at the company's annual general meeting in 2025.

The British public transport group will look for a successor with the help of an external search company, according to a Tuesday filing.

data.title: Bell Potter Upgrades Nufarm to Buy from Hold; Price Target is AU$4.35
data.description: Nufarm has an average rating of outperform and price targets ranging from AU$3.75 to AU$7.70, according to analysts polled by Capital IQ.

data.title: Pryce's Net Income Soars 30.4% in 2024
data.description:
Pryce Corp. said its net income jumped 30.4% in 2024 to 3.07 billion Philippine pesos from 2.36 billion pesos a year prior.

The Philippine real estate developer attributed the higher income to the improvement of LPG margins, according to a Tuesday Philippine bourse filing.

Consolidated revenue also rose 6.3% annually to 20.5 billion pesos versus 19.3 billion pesos a year prior, it noted.

data.title: Sasol, Anglo American and De Beers to pilot renewable diesel in South Africa
data.description:
South African petrochemicals company Sasol , mining group Anglo American and its diamond business De Beers entered into a joint development agreement on Tuesday to pilot the production of renewable diesel from vegetable oil.

Under the terms of the deal signed at the annual African Mining Indaba in Cape Town, the partners will assess the technical and commercial viability of feedstock production, company officials told reporters.

De Beers is providing the more than 20-hectare tracts of land on which the crops for the trial vegetable oil feedstock - initially the Solaris and Moringa plants - will be grown, Anglo American's Director of Projects and Development Alison Atkinson said.

Atkinson said pre-feasibility studies have been approved and renewable diesel production trials have been initiated. The resulting fuel will be used at De Beers operations.

Biofuels, derived from plant material or animal waste, are among the alternative fuels promoted to reduce carbon emissions.

Although renewable diesel production in South Africa is not yet at a commercial scale, customer demand and decarbonisation targets indicate that the country's renewable fuels market is promising, according to Sasol.

"Renewable diesel is transformative. It meets the technical standards of conventional diesel while significantly reducing greenhouse gas emissions," Sarushen Pillay, executive vice president of Sasol's Business Building, Strategy and Technology portfolio, said at the signing ceremony.

data.title: StanChart names Maria Ramos as chair to replace Vinals
data.description:
Standard Chartered appointed Maria Ramos as chair to succeed Jose Vinals, who is approaching the end of his nine-year term, the lender said on Tuesday.

Ramos, 65, joined Standard Chartered's board as an independent non-executive director in January 2021.
